text: Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi (;"Jacobi, Carl Gustav Jacob". Random House Webster's Unabridged Dictionary. ; 10 December 1804 – 18 February 1851) was a German mathematician who contributed to elliptic functions, differential equations, determinants, and number theory. He was the first Jewish mathematician to be appointed professor at a German university. ==Other websites== * Jacobi's Vorlesungen über Dynamik * * * * * Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi - Œuvres complètes Gallica-Math ==References== Category:1804 births Category:1851 deaths Category:People from Potsdam Category:German Jews Category:German number theorists Category:German geometers
title: Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi
